root.name: curve()
root.description: Draws a curved line on the screen. The first and second parameters specify the first anchor point and the last two parameters specify the second anchor. The middle parameters specify the points for defining the shape of the curve. Longer curves can be created by putting a series of curve() functions together. An additional function called curveTightness() provides control for the visual quality of the curve. The curve() function is an implementation of Catmull-Rom splines.
root.syntax: curve(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4);

parameter.label: x1
parameter.description: int or float: x-coordinate of the first anchor

parameter.label: y1
parameter.description: int or float: y-coordinate of the first anchor

parameter.label: x2
parameter.description: int or float: x-coordinate of the first point

parameter.label: y2
parameter.description: int or float: y-coordinate of the first point

parameter.label: x3
parameter.description: int or float: x-coordinate of the second point

parameter.label: y3
parameter.description: int or float: y-coordinate of the second point

parameter.label: x4
parameter.description: int or float: x-coordinate of the second anchor

parameter.label: y4
parameter.description: int or float: y-coordinate of the second anchor
